Title: Operations Analyst - Experienced Graduates (Spring 2025 start)
RoleDescription:
Spring 2025 Start
Location: Boston, MA
This is a Boston, MA based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation.
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Who We Are:Wayfairs Operations organization is revolutionizing the customer experience through the development of a proprietary logistics network and optimization platform that manages inventory from overseas factories to customers front door. This team works directly with suppliers, vendors, and customers to provide new levels of efficiency and performance. They also interact internally with Product, Engineering, and Business Intelligence teams to generate the core analytical insights that enable Wayfair to tackle transportation, warehousing, and delivery challenges. As an Analyst, youll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantage for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the day-to-day efficiency of a complex and sophisticated global supply chain.
We are looking for analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individuals that can translate business problems to actionable insights and data driven solutions to influence operational results. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.
What You'll Do 

Manage processes and drive engagement with key cross-functional partners
Leverage analytical methods and visualization to translate data sets into actionable insights to drive business decisions and outcomes
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build reporting in Google Sheets
Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand the health of Wayfairs supply chain network and determine ways to break down problems into action-oriented solutions
Develop and drive adherence to sustainable long-term performance management frameworks to improve performance across multiple process paths in our supply chain
Monitor key performance indicators and assess how were making progress against our core metrics and OKRs
Work cross-functionally with a variety of teams including Warehousing, Transportation, Technology, and Supplier facing teams

What You'll Need Basic Qualifications

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience.
Experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Familiarity with any programming language (R, Python) is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings 
Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners
High attention to detail, zero-defect analysis and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective 
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change 

 
Possible Team Placements Include:

Network Planning and Orchestration: The Network Planning and Orchestration team is a part of Network Management (NM), sits at the heart of Wayfairs supply chain. They play a key role in planning, coordinating, and managing performance across Warehouses, Transportation, and Technology to ensure SLAs are met and customer orders flow smoothly. NM sets SLAs for the network to optimize Speed, Cost and Capacity, performance manages teams against these and stands up process improvement projects to optimize the network around these SLAs.
Global Supply Chain: Wayfair's Global Supply Chain (GSC) team is a network of interconnected global departments that support the journey of a product once an order is placed. This includes teams that manage all aspects of the Transportation & Delivery function, teams that support the frontline operations, and teams that manage and monetize Returns & Incidents. The objective of the GSC team is to get orders to customers' homes quickly, reliably, and conveniently, while enhancing the customer experience by preventing and reducing product defects. As a part of the GSC team, you will have an important role in accomplishing our mission: delivering cost-efficient perfect orders at scale.
Global Service: The global service teams are responsible for setting the standards on how we deliver an excellent experience to our customers. We identify customer channel disconnects, drive improvements for a smooth and frictionless customer experience, recommend technology solutions, and train our frontline agents

Title: Senior Manager, Head of Sustainability
RoleDescription:
We are seeking a strategic and results-oriented leader to drive Wayfairs global sustainability agenda. As the Senior Manager, Head of Sustainability, you will be responsible for shaping and advancing Wayfairs sustainability initiatives, integrating sustainability into core business operations, and ensuring adherence to evolving regulatory and industry standards. This role requires deep subject matter expertise, strong leadership skills, and the ability to align sustainability efforts with business priorities. You will lead a team of professionals, leverage data-driven insights to inform decision-making, and collaborate across functions to accelerate Wayfairs progress toward its sustainability goals while delivering long-term business value.
What You'll Do

Lead the development and execution of a comprehensive global sustainability strategy that aligns with Wayfairs corporate goals and drives long-term business value.
Lead a team of sustainability professionals, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making, organizational efficiency, and continuous innovation and improvement.
Design and integrate sustainability initiatives across Wayfairs global operations, embedding sustainable business practices while ensuring strong financial and operational returns.
Drive projects focused on carbon reduction, waste minimization, and energy efficiency to meet Wayfairs public sustainability commitments.
Oversee the collection, analysis, and transparent reporting of sustainability data, ensuring regulatory compliance, auditability, and alignment with industry standards.
Stay informed on environmental regulations, global sustainability trends, and emerging best practices to guide corporate decision-making and identify risks and opportunities.
Engage with internal and external stakeholders, including regulatory bodies, industry groups, and sustainability organizations, to advance Wayfairs sustainability agenda and facilitate industry benchmarking.

What You'll Need

Bachelors degree and 8+ years of experience leading corporate sustainability programs.
Strong ability to build, mentor, and lead high-performing teams.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and consensus-building skills, with the ability to drive results across functions.
Proven ability to translate complex sustainability challenges into actionable business solutions.
Strong understanding of financial and operational impacts of sustainability initiatives.
Deep knowledge of sustainability frameworks, environmental metrics, and reporting standards.
Solutions-oriented mindset with the ability to navigate fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Highly organized, data-driven, and adept at managing multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Self-motivated with a proactive approach to tackling challenges and driving meaningful outcomes.

This position will be based in our Boston office. At Wayfair, Enterprise employees are required to be in the office Monday through Thursday, with Fridays remote.

Title: Project Manager - Physical Retail Installations
RoleDescription:
This is a full-time, salaried role based in Boston. Employees are expected to work in-office Monday - Thursday, Friday is optional WFH. 
 
Wayfair is seeking a dynamic and organized Installations Manager to join our growing Physical Retail team. This role is crucial in ensuring the seamless and efficient execution of all in-store and Retail Lab installations, directly impacting the visual presentation and customer experience of our physical spaces. The ideal candidate will possess a blend of project management acumen and a strong understanding of in-store visual merchandising principles.
Responsibilities:
Project Management:


Develop and manage comprehensive project plans from conception to completion for all in-store installations, including visual merchandising displays, fixtures, and mock store builds.
Establish clear timelines, milestones, and deliverables for each project, ensuring on-time and within-budget execution.
Proactively identify and mitigate potential project risks and roadblocks.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including schedules, budgets, and vendor communications.


Vendor Management:


Source, vet, and manage relationships with third-party vendors, including installers, contractors, and other service providers.
Negotiate contracts and ensure vendor compliance with project specifications and quality standards.
Schedule and coordinate vendor activities to align with project timelines.
Book travel for vendors, and yourself as needed.


Visual Merchandising Expertise:


Collaborate with the Visual Merchandising team to translate design concepts into actionable installation plans.
Ensure that all installations adhere to brand standards and visual merchandising guidelines.
Provide on-site support and guidance if needed during installations, ensuring accurate execution and addressing any issues that may arise.


Process Development & Scalability:


Develop and implement standardized processes and procedures for in-store installations to ensure consistency and efficiency across all locations.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization to support the scalability of Wayfair's physical retail footprint.
Create and maintain a central database for all installation information, including vendor contacts, installation guides, and project documentation.


Store Accountability & Communication:


Establish clear lines of communication with store teams, providing regular updates on project progress and addressing any concerns.
Hold store teams accountable for the proper maintenance and upkeep of installed displays and fixtures, even when not onsite.
Conduct post-installation reviews to evaluate project success and identify areas for improvement.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:


Work closely with the Builds team, Visual Merchandising team, and other cross-functional partners to ensure seamless project execution.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, proactively providing regular updates and addressing any questions or concerns.


Qualifications:

Proven experience in in-store visual merchandising.
Project management experience is preferred, but not required.
Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.  
Familiar with simple vinyl installations.
Ability to read and interpret construction documents and visual merchandising plans.  
Ability to travel as needed to support store installations.
Ability to create and maintain budgets.
Ability to create and maintain project timelines.
A proactive, problem-solving attitude with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
Ability to create scalable processes.
Physical ability to lift up to 25 lbs., hang frames/artwork, and work on 8-12-ft. ladders as needed.
20-30% travel required for store visits and new store openings.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience managing third-party vendors and contractors.
Experience with retail construction or build-outs.
Experience with reading and understanding blue prints.
Familiarity with Sketch-Up or similar software.
Familiarity with Google Workspace.

Title: Manager, Financial Planning and Analysis
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
About Financial Planning and Analysis at Wayfair: With Wayfairs focus on profitable operations comes the need for strong financial partnership, planning, and support across the business. The Financial Planning and Analysis team works collaboratively with various teams across the business to drive fiscal accountability, provide visibility into actual performance and shape our forecast based on most current trends and business insights. Our work provides the business with financial insights that directly impact the direction of Wayfair's business. We enjoy tackling challenging problems and translating quantitative analyses into strategic business implications.
About this role: 
Wayfair is looking for a financial leader to manage our OPEX spend planning and reporting processes (including compensation and third party spend). The individual will lead a team of three to four analysts. In this role, you will partner with ~40 senior leaders in the Wayfair organization and support them in managing their compensation and outsourced labor spend against the quarterly spend targets. In addition, you will own the overall OPEX cost planning as part of Wayfairs quarterly planning and forecasting cycle. You will coordinate the monthly actuals reporting both to your stakeholders and within the finance organization and will own the rolling forecast preparation for your area. 
What Youll Do:

Partner with senior stakeholders to drive monthly planning, reporting and analyses of spent vs targets. 
Coordinate the global quarterly forecasting process for OPEX spend.
Lead month-end and quarter-end close forecast to actuals variance analysis and review.
Drive delivery of and improvement in all internal management reporting through automation and AI, reporting visualization and enabling of self-serve stakeholder capabilities.
Attract, develop and retain a high-performing finance team.

What Youll Need:

Bachelor's degree (in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Accounting Information Systems or related field preferred).
5+ years of experience in corporate finance, talent analytics, or similar analytics roles.
Proven cross-functional partnership skills with diverse set of senior leadership.
Exceptional analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
Proven ability to model and forecast with accuracy.
Experience / familiarity with any of SQL, Looker, Workday, Coupa or similar procurement and Human Capital Management systems; Excel / Gsheet advanced modeling skills.
Demonstrated experience leading and developing a team.
Superb attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and deliver in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Head of NA Sales - CastleGate Forwarding
RoleDescription:
CastleGate Forwarding (CGF) is a rapidly growing freight forwarding start-up within Wayfair, moving containers across the globe. We offer a full suite of shipping services (Asia consolidation, ocean freight, drayage, customs brokerage, cargo protect, etc.) that aims to provide Wayfair suppliers with predictable, reliable, and competitive Freight Forwarding solutions.
As part of CGF, you will play a key role in defining and executing Sales strategies across North America. You will collaborate with business unit leaders across the International Supply Chain and drive strategic decisions within and beyond your region. As you pursue strong relationships with Wayfair suppliers, success will be demonstrated by increasing supplier satisfaction and growing the volume shipped by CastleGate Forwarding. This is a highly visible and exciting leadership role and one that will offer the right candidate an opportunity to be part of a fast growing environment within the e-commerce industry.
What You'll Do 

Define targets and performance manage a large team to meet CGFs volume and profitability goals in North America for each of our business lines.
Deliver on cross functional initiatives to maintain high supplier satisfaction across Wayfairs supplier portfolio (ex NPS Targets)
Build team capabilities to allow for effective acquisition and supplier management of Wayfair suppliers (CGF customers) of all sizes and business models. 
Drive initiatives that improve volume, profitability, & supplier satisfaction. 
Hire and manage a team of Sales Managers and Associates, including launching and overseeing a Lead Generation Team
Support the professional growth of the team within CGF and overall Wayfair operations
Partner closely with other supplier-facing teams (e.g. Commercial, Inventory Management, Fulfillment) to share insights and feedback and drive increased volume
Identify and drive opportunities for service enhancements to further strengthen our value proposition through our Voice of the Customer Program
Optimize Sales Efficiencies in our CRM (Salesforce) and through inbound lead sourcing & pipeline management. 
Travel between 25%-50% of the time to Tradeshows, Supplier sites, and Industry Conferences

What You'll Need 

5+ years of sales experience/business development in the ocean/freight forwarding or International Supply Chain industry

Work cross-functionally with commercial stakeholders to understand business problems or opportunities and develop appropriately scoped analytical solutions

Solid hands-on expertise deploying machine learning solutions into production
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and ML algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, etc. 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiastic about continuous learning

Nice to have

Experience with Python ML ecosystem (numpy, pandas, sklearn, XGBoost, etc.) and/or Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML)
Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), ML model development frameworks, ML orchestration tools (Airflow, Kubeflow or MLFlow)

Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Advertising Ranking & Optimization
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 15 million items across home furnishings, decor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Suppliers are crucial partners in enabling Wayfairs mission. Within Global Supplier Technology (GST), the Supplier Advertising team owns the strategy and development of Wayfairs Supplier Advertising offerings which help suppliers boost visibility of their products and brands on our platform. This high-margin business is one of the biggest opportunities in Wayfairs profitability. 
Millions of customers visit Wayfair. Each time a customer clicks on a page, we strive to show relevant, personalized ads that are going to generate positive return on investment for our supplier advertisers. We achieve this through a combination of relevance models, a real-time auction, and exposing certain controls to advertisers. Achieving optimal auction outcomes is a complex problem requiring trade-offs across several goals. 
As the leader for our Ranking & Optimization team, you will be responsible for maximizing auction outcomes across advertisers and/or customers across millions of auctions every day globally. Achieving this will require creating the right long-term incentives and making complex trade-offs across the system. Ensuring that each ad auction is delivering a positive customer and advertiser experience is critical to the growth and long-term sustainability of the Supplier Advertising program at Wayfair.  
If you are interested in leading an empowered team and solving high-impact problems through a combination of research, applied science, and machine learning, come join us and help Wayfair through our next phase of growth.
What You'll Do

Partner with businesses, machine learning / applied science, and other technology teams to identify opportunities to improve outcomes (conversions, ad revenue, advertiser value) of advertising auctions. 
Define the vision for machine learning applications that will help suppliers efficiently manage their advertising campaigns, such as automated bidding. 
Formulate data-based hypotheses, develop scoring and ranking models, and drive recommendations that address unintended outcomes in the advertising auction or that limit advertiser outcomes.
Define product requirements in collaboration with cross-functional and cross-department teams including supplier experience, ad serving, profitability, and pricing algo teams.
Build long-term (12+mo) roadmap and OKRs for the domain and associated business cases that maintain a critical eye for impact and return on investment across complex, multi-cycle investment areas. 
Partner with the engineering team to drive timely and smooth project execution by performing sprint rituals like grooming, planning and retrospective.
Drive go to market for your products in partnership with sales and account management teams to identify areas of opportunity to grow adoption and impact.
Influence the evolution of Wayfair's strategy for advertising offerings. 

Were A Match Because You Have:

5+ years experience in software product development, with a focus on data-driven products. 
Bachelors degree or higher in Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Economics, Analytics, Business Administration, Operations Research, or a directly related field
Experience with leading highly technical and ML-enabled products. 
Experience within digital advertising or recommendation systems is preferred. 
Track record of effective partnership with engineering and machine learning / applied science to drive large, cross-org initiatives. 
Excellent quantitative skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights and requirements. 
Ability to keep up in highly technical conversations.
Ability to think and act both tactically and strategically.

Title: Manager of wayfair.co.uk Business Trends
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. Title: Software Engineer II, DMLP
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. Take complex engineering problems, design appropriate solutions and deliver on them.
Work on a variety of technologies - from system implementations, to software and tools built in house, to application systems delivering acceleration as a service. 
Implement robust, well-tested services. Provide technical design and code reviews for peers within your team.
Provide insights into opportunity areas for the platform, influencing priorities and team roadmaps in close partnership with Engineering and Product leadership.

What youll Need:

3+ years of experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
Experience in development of new applications using technologies such as Java, Python andSQL
Experience with Cloud Native architecture in one of the big 3 providers (GCP, Azure, AWS).
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch,etc.).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders alike.
Proficient in effective troubleshooting and issue resolution techniques.

Title: Profit Management and Pricing Analyst
RoleDescription:
About the Role: 
We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Analyst for our Profit Management and Pricing team for Wayfair UK and Ireland. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business in the region by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies. Based in our London office, you will work on a five-member team, collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive optimal financial performance.
 
What Youll Do: As a Pricing and Profitability Analyst at Wayfair, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to shape strategies that deliver value to our customers and strengthen supplier partnerships. Your responsibilities will involve diving into data, identifying key trends, and using your insights to support decision-making across various areas of the business. Specific duties include:

Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the UK and Ireland markets.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive branded pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Pricing and Promotions Exection

Update prices on site as our margin strategies evolve, cost models change or in support of promotions.
Simulate expected price changes and QA actuals to ensure accuracy. 

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Business Performance Monitoring and Problem Solving:

Tackle ambiguous challenges by leveraging your analytical skills to generate actionable solutions that deliver measurable improvements in profitability, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
Work with large datasets to identify trends, perform analyses, and develop reports to drive business decisions across different Commercial functions.
Use advanced analytical tools and techniques (Excel, SQL, R, Python) to build data-driven insights and recommend improvements.
Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Work closely with Finance, Marketing, and Supplier Partnerships teams to align pricing strategies with broader business goals.
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.


What Were Looking For

Educational Background:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant discipline (eg. business, analytics, statistics, economics) 


Exceptional Analytical and Quantitative Skills: 

Excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings 


Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Google BigQuery, Excel) and motivated to learn and develop further. Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.


Strong business acumen: 

Ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective 


Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills

Ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity 


Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to work across diverse teams and levels of an organization.
